alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 22 at 3:20AM CDT until August 22 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT /NOON MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and western Texas, including the following areas, in southwest Texas, Central Brewster County, Chinati Mountains, Chisos Basin, Davis Mountains, Davis Mountains Foothills, Eastern Culberson County, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains, Lower Brewster County, Marfa Plateau, Pecos, Presidio Valley, Terrell and Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor. In western Texas, Reeves County Plains. * WHEN...From 1 PM CDT /Noon MDT/ this afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The remnants of a tropical cyclone will move across the area beginning Tuesday and last into early Wednesday evening. Very heavy rain is expected and could cause flash flooding especially across the Big Bend region and Presidio Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
